item.title: Problem with my code, please help
item.dc:creator: @runegay runegay
item.description:
@runegay wrote:

i delete one and then i get this

[code]
client.java:29135: illegal start of type
else if(playerLevel[3] >= 0)
^
client.java:29145: expected

^
2 errors
Starting pimpscape Server on 0.0.0.0:5555
config\objects.cfg: file not found.

[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2008, 09:58:25 PM[/size][hr]nvm i fixed it

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with my code, please help
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Obviously above else if(playerLevel[3] >= 0) you have one too many closing braces (})

Read full topic

item.source: Problem with my code, please help

item.title: Problem with my code, please help
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

That error has been thrown to indicate that the class file has been closed. Thus meaning you have added an extra closing brace (})
Remember, for every opening brace ({) you need to close that with a closing brace (})

Read full topic
item.source: Problem with my code, please help

item.title: Problem with my code, please help
item.dc:creator: @runegay runegay
item.description:
@runegay wrote:

i made a code so i could make a “godsword”(its really a d long renamed to “godsword” with +500 bonuses) here it is:

else if(playerLevel[3] >= 0)
			{
					if(itemUsed == 536 && useWith == 2450) 
						deleteItem(536, getItemSlot(536), 1);
						addItem(1305, 1);
						addSkillXP(4000000, 3);
						sendMessage("You pour the zamorak brew on the dragon	bones.");
						sendMessage("the bones disolve into a godsword!");
						//sendFrame126("Congratulations, you just	made a godsword. You pwn!!!", 6248);
					}

and in my compiler i get the error:

client.java:29135: 'class' or 'interface' expected
                         if(playerLevel[3] >= 0)
                         ^
1 error
Starting pimpscape Server on 0.0.0.0:5555
config\objects.cfg: file not found.

can anyone help?
by the way i use a pimpscape based source. according to my compiler

Read full topic
item.source: Problem with my code, please help
